Description: Corroded copper alloy cylindrical measuring-vessel (?); part of the upper body and rim are missing.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, North-west Ptolemaic mound
Curator's comments: Probably one of the "two bronze vessels..., cylindirical with flat base, 4.0 in. across and 4.8 in. high", found on the NW mound, mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 79 § 79; see also ibid., p. 61 § 57, where Petrie says he found "three bronze pots of cylindrical form". The two other pots are London, BM 1888,0208.146 and Boston, MFA, 87.496a-b
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 61 § 57, p. 79 § 79)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.40, p.42, p.51, p.52, fig.1, p.173, pl.15)
